sources.data_found: Overview page confirms Rivanna is the university's primary high-performance computing cluster.
UVA Institutional Research & Analytics (Fall 2024 Census): Lists ~1,416 BS Computer Science (Engineering) and ~680 BA Computer Science (Arts & Sciences). Lists ~168 PhD and ~136 Masters students.
Hardware Configuration table lists GPU node types and counts: A100, H200, A40, A6000, RTX2080Ti, RTX3090, V100.
Rivanna and Afton systems provide access to 55 nodes with NVIDIA GPUs including A100 and H200.
Includes an 18-node DGX BasePOD system with 8x A100 GPU devices per node.
Department includes over 200 graduate students and 1400 undergraduates.
DGX BasePOD: 18 DGX A100 nodes with 80GB GPUs; 1 HGX H200 server.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count (2096) is the aggregate of the BS Computer Science in the School of Engineering (~1,416) and BA Computer Science in the College of Arts & Sciences (~680) per Fall 2024 Census data. Graduate student counts vary by source definition: one source lists 136 Masters + 168 PhD (Total 304), while another lists 248 total graduate students. The highest specific PhD count (168) was preserved.

gpu_resources.notes:
Counts represent the maximum values identified across models. Key resources include the Rivanna cluster and an NVIDIA DGX BasePOD. 
- A100 80GB: 18 nodes x 8 GPUs (BasePOD) = 144 GPUs.
- A100 40GB: Conflicting node counts (2 vs 8 nodes); highest value (64) used.
- H200: 1 node x 8 GPUs identified.
- A40: 12 nodes x 8 GPUs = 96.
- A6000: 14 nodes x 8 GPUs = 112.
- Older hardware (P100, V100, K80) counts sourced from hardware overview tables.

analysis_notes: Ensemble result aggregated from OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini models. Student enrollment figures show significant variance due to the split between Engineering (BS) and Arts & Sciences (BA) tracks; the aggregated figure sums both. GPU resources indicate a strong mix of high-end research nodes (A100/H200) and dense visualization/compute nodes (A40/A6000).
validation_notes: No changes made. All GPU resources appear to be university-owned. Student data is complete and consistent.
